input_text:
Job Title: Digital Print Specialist

Location: Dulles, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Join a member-driven leader in a fast-paced, challenging and collaborative environment with the shared mission of supporting America’s network of rural electric cooperatives. Since its formation in 1969, National Rural Utilities Cooperative Finance Corporation, or CFC, located in Dulles, Virginia, has provided capital and industry-leading financial products to more than 900 not-for-profit, consumer-controlled utility systems across the United States. Our exceptional team delivers the “CFC Difference” that encompasses our values of service, integrity and excellence in all our interactions.

CFC has a need for a Digital Print Specialist to join the Business Center team. The Digital Print Specialist produces quality documents using desktop publishing, digital printing and finishing technology, as well as distributes corporate information as needed.

As the Digital Print Specialist, you will:

 Produce professional looking documents using digital copier, binding and finishing equipment. Design and layout print documents using desktop publishing software to automate and enhance the print process. Fix or coordinate repair for copiers and printers. Provide Chauffeur/transportation services to members and guests using CFC corporate vehicles. Issue building access badges for incoming visitors and contractors through the loading dock.

To be successful, you will need:

 High school diploma or GED required. A minimum of two years of experience with printing and binding equipment, three years preferred. Experience driving a large passenger van. Valid driver’s license required. Ability to drive 15 passenger van (No CDL required). Working knowledge of postal and shipping regulations and systems. Strong working knowledge of digital printing, make ready software, binding and finishing technology. Must be able to create and export digital files, CD’s and DVD’s. Proficiency in mass mail merging. Good customer service, communication, organizational and phone etiquette skills. Familiarity with OSHA standards and standard safety practices used in the operation and Maintenance field. Team oriented, as well as able to work independently. Ability to organize and prioritize tasks.

Additional Requirements:

 Must be able to lift and transport 50 – 70 lbs. Significant amount of hours spent on feet. Current licenses in CPR and First Aid preferred.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes annual incentive opportunities; an employer-paid pension plan; 401(k); medical, dental and vision insurance; a generous leave policy; onsite gym; and more—all in a friendly, professional work environment. For additional information, please visit our website at www.nrucfc.coop. CFC is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to workforce diversity.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
